title: WHIRLING F2 ORB / Ultraliberal Quest Initiation
description: Savoir Faire tells you it's time to stop playing the market and make some real cash so you can fulfil your heart's desire.

dialogueTree.title: Savoir Faire: "Hey, money-mouth. Eendracht. The im..."
dialogueTree.text: Hey, money-mouth. Eendracht. The impeccable hustler-provider of the seventh generation. It's showtime with Savvy!

links.title: You: "Oh, so now it's Savvy? What's up, b..."
links.text: Oh, so now it's Savvy? What's up, buddy?

links.title: Savoir Faire: "What's up? I'm worried about what's..."
links.text: What's up? I'm worried about what's *down*, broke boy. I'm talking about your severe lack of money.

links.title: You: "Money?!"
links.text: Money?!

links.title: Savoir Faire: "That's right! It's time to stop mut..."
links.text: That's right! It's time to stop muttering about your 'economic self-interest' and actually do something about it. Yeah, I heard you back there. What the hell was that?!

links.title: You: "Superstar talk. Don't try to keep u..."
links.text: Superstar talk. Don't try to keep up with me and my vast dreams.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Superstar talk? Good one, hustler,..."
links.text: Superstar talk? Good one, hustler, gotta keep the dream alive. But it's not really showing up in your net worth yet, is it? And it's what -- day two, three, four?

links.title: Logic: "It's day four if we're counting day..."
links.text: It's day four if we're counting days since the *event*.

links.title: You: "It is but a symptom of the rapaciou..."
links.text: It is but a symptom of the rapacious catastrophe that will devour us all.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Brilliant, catastrophes are *prime..."
links.text: Brilliant, catastrophes are *prime time* for money-makers. But you're not really reaping any benefits yet, are you? No shorting, no shameless speculation...

links.title: Half Light: "Just take my money and leave me alo..."
links.text: Just take my money and leave me alone!

links.title: You: "I was asleep."
links.text: I was asleep.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Exactly. Not making money when you'..."
links.text: Exactly. Not making money when you're asleep, are you? If you wanna be rich you better work until your fingers bleed. You can sleep when you die.

links.title: Endurance: "(Your pecs dance.) No more sleep it..."
links.text: (Your pecs dance.) No more sleep it is. A frazzled ride through eternity without pause. Hissing pistons pushed to the extreme.

links.title: You: "It's pathetic -- I know. Sorry you..."
links.text: It's pathetic -- I know. Sorry you have to hang around with me. I'll do better.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "No, don't you ever be sorry. You th..."
links.text: No, don't you ever be sorry. You think the Salzneben Report's Top 500 has 'sorry' in their vocabulary? Think again. That's a loser's mindset.

links.title: Authority: "Take heed of these wise words. *You..."
links.text: Take heed of these wise words. *You're* in charge. 'Sorry' is a beggar's plea reserved for those beneath you.

links.title: You: "You said before that playing the ma..."
links.text: You said before that playing the market could get me *rich*.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Oh, it can. But first you need to *..."
links.text: Oh, it can. But first you need to *enter* the market. Right now you're as good as Samir Loisir eating dirt in Gurdi's immense network of mines.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Samir Loisir was a Gurdi businessma..."
links.text: Samir Loisir was a Gurdi businessman who made his first millions selling kilograms of the ultra-rare mineral phasium to luxury jeweller Zachaël et Cie. He made the rest of his many millions through wise investments and the invention of pleochroic lights.

links.title: You: "I'm just tired of being a low-net-w..."
links.text: I'm just tired of being a low-net-worth-individual. It must be *the curse*.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Did Ilona Wihuri-Vilakone blame gho..."
links.text: Did Ilona Wihuri-Vilakone blame ghosts? How about Admiral Gustav Lestock? Samir Loisir grew up in the coal mines of Gurdi eating dirt, and he still managed to make FIFTY-FIVE BILLION REÁL in his lifetime. So stop with the excuses.

links.title: Logic: "Fifty-five billion reál is a gross..."
links.text: Fifty-five billion reál is a gross overestimation and we're pretty sure eating dirt is going to send any kid to a hospital, even Samir Loisir.

links.title: You: "What do you expect? I'm an ultralib..."
links.text: What do you expect? I'm an ultraliberal. I speak ultraliberal-ese.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Good, good, gotta spread the gospel..."
links.text: Good, good, gotta spread the gospel. But talk alone doesn't bring in the cash. It's time for step two.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Listen, if you really want to make..."
links.text: Listen, if you really want to make it in the big leagues, you need to *re-conceptualize* your entire portfolio. Collecting tare and moaning about taxes is not going to cut it.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "You need to become a MILLIONAIRE. N..."
links.text: You need to become a MILLIONAIRE. Now, how do you become a MILLIONAIRE?

links.title: You: "Does this giant check that Evrart g..."
links.text: Does this giant check that Evrart gave me help?

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Not unless you have thousands of th..."
links.text: Not unless you have thousands of them stuffed away in secret.

links.title: You: "Mañana flicked me a coin."
links.text: Mañana flicked me a coin.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "*One* coin. The first of many. Imag..."
links.text: *One* coin. The first of many. Imagine so many coins you're going to need to hire someone to help you manage all your wealth.

links.title: You: "I assume begging rich ladies on boa..."
links.text: I assume begging rich ladies on boats is not the correct answer.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "It should be the other way around...."
links.text: It should be the other way around. Old mitred money showing up at your doorstep, begging for a slice of cake.

links.title: You: "I could sell Kim's motorcar, like I..."
links.text: I could sell Kim's motorcar, like I sold his spinners?

links.title: Savoir Faire: "And then what? Join the ranks of bl..."
links.text: And then what? Join the ranks of blue-collar criminals?

links.title: You: "I could pitch another project to th..."
links.text: I could pitch another project to this Mega Rich Light-Bending Guy in the container?

links.title: Savoir Faire: "We're getting somewhere. But what p..."
links.text: We're getting somewhere. But what project? And what's the ROI?

links.title: You: "Really, that's it? That's all I hav..."
links.text: Really, that's it? That's all I have to say? Why aren't *you guys* helping me out?

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Those guys? They're all financially..."
links.text: Those guys? They're all financially illiterate. Only Savvy here knows how to *dazzle* and *embezzle* money out of investors' pockets with the acrobatic prowess of a four-time gold medallist in the Samaran Gymnastic Summer Games.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "The ancient Samaran tribes used car..."
links.text: The ancient Samaran tribes used carved rhodochrosite to represent their wealth. The bigger the boulder, the more money they had. In case you needed to know.

links.title: Empathy: "Money is only one form of capital,..."
links.text: Money is only one form of capital, *human relations* are another. You're focusing on the wrong things.

links.title: Endurance: "You could force a coin *inside* you..."
links.text: You could force a coin *inside* you? Any hole will do. Not many more definitive tests of a man's mettle than the fortune yawn.

links.title: You: "Alright, I give up -- I have no ide..."
links.text: Alright, I give up -- I have no idea how to make millions.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Of course you don't. You've never e..."
links.text: Of course you don't. You've never even been *close* to a sum with more than three zeros. Let's face it, you've been on a years-long losing streak...

links.title: Savoir Faire: "But Savvy's got your back. Savvy's..."
links.text: But Savvy's got your back. Savvy's going to book you a charter flight with eighty birds of prey on board, to a land where the streets are paved with krugerrands and fixed-income securities. You'll try again, but this time with *money*. You'll win her back.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Are you in?"
links.text: Are you in?

links.title: You: "Wait, win *whom* back?"
links.text: Wait, win *whom* back?

links.title: Savoir Faire: "The spirit of ultraliberalism. Your..."
links.text: The spirit of ultraliberalism. Your charm, your spin, your winning hand.

links.title: You: "I've hustled, I've *grinded*. Show..."
links.text: I've hustled, I've *grinded*. Show me the millions. (Opt in.)

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Attaboy, welcome to the final grind..."
links.text: Attaboy, welcome to the final grind! Here we operate with money on a *much* higher level than the ordinary citizen, we feed it back into the machine. Stop saving, start spending -- become a *patron*...

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Let's start by getting you into the..."
links.text: Let's start by getting you into the lucrative art market to diversify your assets and increase your ROI. Speaking of which, know any artists?

links.title: Suggestion: "Perfect, all you have to do is *pre..."
links.text: Perfect, all you have to do is *pretend* to have taste. This will be your weapon when swindling artists for their overpriced 'work'.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Interesting. Are we speaking of vis..."
links.text: Interesting. Are we speaking of visual art or something more *conceptual*?

links.title: Shivers: "Somewhere in La Delta, numbers flip..."
links.text: Somewhere in La Delta, numbers flip and whirl on the giant split-flap boards of the stock exchange, marking gains the size of Kemi SR's entire economy. Radiocomputers hum below to the tune of gambling.

links.title: You: "Hold on, I thought we'd be getting..."
links.text: Hold on, I thought we'd be getting into the stock market?

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Do you see any stock markets in Mar..."
links.text: Do you see any stock markets in Martinaise? No? That's because for those living in the outskirts, the market is *nothing*. Just ghost numbers flicking through time. A spectral sport they're not invited to play.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "No, you need something *real*, some..."
links.text: No, you need something *real*, something you can hold on to with all your claws and teeth.

links.title: You: "Wait, so we're looking for a painti..."
links.text: Wait, so we're looking for a painting?

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Stop thinking of it that way. It's..."
links.text: Stop thinking of it that way. It's not a 'painting', it's a 'highly collectible and irreproducible asset'. So, know any local artists with assets to sell?

links.title: Conceptualization: "What is this, the turn of the centu..."
links.text: What is this, the turn of the century? The world's moved beyond paintings. You want something *experimental* -- intramuscular puppetry, hyperrealistic vapour-porn, meditation opera...

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Don't listen to this fool. It's not..."
links.text: Don't listen to this fool. It's not about the artists, it's about the *buyers*. You can't hang 'vapour-porn' in the foyer of your chalet.

links.title: You: "Good thing I've been preparing for..."
links.text: Good thing I've been preparing for this with my Actual Art Degree.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Don't be silly, the art market isn'..."
links.text: Don't be silly, the art market isn't about art, it's about gate-keeping, speculative bidding, and showboating.

links.title: You: "Artists, artists... I'm an artist m..."
links.text: Artists, artists... I'm an artist myself.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Once we've brought in the millions..."
links.text: Once we've brought in the millions you can be a tree log for all I care, but first we've got to work on increasing your net worth.

links.title: You: "What about the speedfreaks' anodic..."
links.text: What about the speedfreaks' anodic dance music?

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Music is a pet project, not a viabl..."
links.text: Music is a pet project, not a viable business scheme. Let's return to it once you've set up your estate.

links.title: You: "Cuno? Cuno is an artist."
links.text: Cuno? Cuno is an artist.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "He's also twelve. We don't want to..."
links.text: He's also twelve. We don't want to attract the attention of tax collectors by dabbling in unnecessary child-labour.

links.title: Conceptualization: "He does have potential... defying a..."
links.text: He does have potential... defying authority, thinking outside the box...

links.title: Authority: "That child's a common delinquent, n..."
links.text: That child's a common delinquent, not an artist. He probably can't even hold a paint brush.

links.title: You: "Cindy seems the type."
links.text: Cindy seems the type.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "You're right. She has the poise of..."
links.text: You're right. She has the poise of a struggling artist. Very *tangible*. You can *feel* the poverty on her. Plus, she has paint.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Go and support her like the state n..."
links.text: Go and support her like the state never could. Everyone must know that you're a big fucking shark around here!

links.title: You: "No one comes to mind."
links.text: No one comes to mind.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "By all accounts this place should b..."
links.text: By all accounts this place should be *swarming* with artist-types. It's just a matter of time until you meet one. Look for squats and cheap rentals, we might even chance upon a *political artivist* here.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Go and support them like the state..."
links.text: Go and support them like the state never could. Everyone must know that you're a big fucking shark around here!

links.title: You: "Something about this doesn't sit ri..."
links.text: Something about this doesn't sit right...

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Stop grumbling, it's time to move...."
links.text: Stop grumbling, it's time to move. Are you in or are you out?

links.title: You: "Alright, then. Show me the millions..."
links.text: Alright, then. Show me the millions. (Opt in.)

links.title: You: "Actually I'm good on the money fron..."
links.text: Actually I'm good on the money front. [Opt out.]

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Suit yourself and your middle-class..."
links.text: Suit yourself and your middle-class ways -- Savvy doesn't need you, Savvy's got his own *entourage*.

links.title: You: "I know all about money."
links.text: I know all about money.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "No, you don't! You just keep mutter..."
links.text: No, you don't! You just keep muttering about your 'economic self-interest' and not doing anything about it. Yeah, I heard you back there. What the hell was that?!

links.title: You: "Do I know you?"
links.text: Do I know you?

links.title: Savoir Faire: "You will. I'm here to make your lif..."
links.text: You will. I'm here to make your life better. They call me the Man-About-Town. Gilded Heart-Throb. Master of Money.

links.title: You: "Are we finally going to solve the l..."
links.text: Are we finally going to solve the lynching?

links.title: Savoir Faire: "What? No, screw that shit-show. You..."
links.text: What? No, screw that shit-show. You're at the centre of this one. Come on down, contestant, you're about to make some *money*.

links.title: You: "Eendracht? The hustler-provider? Th..."
links.text: Eendracht? The hustler-provider? The *seventh* generation?!

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Yeah, swindle-father. Papa-preneur...."
links.text: Yeah, swindle-father. Papa-preneur. Look, this is serious. No time for distractions. It's time to make *money*. Lots of it.

links.title: You: "Not today, thanks. [Discard thought..."
links.text: Not today, thanks. [Discard thought.]
